meanings.definition: to send something to the wrong destination
meanings.sent1: She mispatches the letters and they end up in the wrong mailbox.
meanings.sent2: The post office mispatches packages sometimes, causing delays.
meanings.sent3: The mispatches in the mail system led to a mix-up of birthday cards.
meanings.sent4: Her mind mispatches the addresses like a confused GPS.
meanings.sent5: The image of mispatches is like a jumbled puzzle of addresses.

meanings.sent1: The mispatches in the email caused confusion among the team.
meanings.sent2: Delivery companies strive to minimize mispatches in their services.
meanings.sent3: The mispatches in the conversation made everyone laugh at the mix-up.
meanings.sent4: The mispatches in the system were like hidden traps waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The word 'mispatches' instantly brings to mind delivery mistakes.

meanings.sent1: She noticed the mispatches colors on the painting.
meanings.sent2: The mispatches socks made him look mismatched.
meanings.sent3: The mispatches shoes gave him a unique fashion statement.
meanings.sent4: The mispatches patterns clashed in an oddly appealing way.
meanings.sent5: The mispatches items stood out in a sea of uniformity.
